block.p: Grace Wong, the daughter of Mimi Lai Ching Wong of Hong Kong and the late Joseph Cho Chuan Wong, was married yesterday to Michael Robert Donohue, a son of Barbara and Robert Donohue of Ridgewood, N.J. Msgr. Ronald A. Richardson performed the ceremony at the Queen of the Most Holy Rosary Church in Bridgehampton, N.Y.

Grace Wong, the daughter of Mimi Lai Ching Wong of Hong Kong and the late Joseph Cho Chuan Wong, was married yesterday to Michael Robert Donohue, a son of Barbara and Robert Donohue of Ridgewood, N.J. Msgr. Ronald A. Richardson performed the ceremony at the Queen of the Most Holy Rosary Church in Bridgehampton, N.Y.

The bride, 31, and the bridegroom, 30, work in San Francisco, where she is the domestic media director at Gap, the clothing chain, and he is an account supervisor in the sports marketing department of Foote, Cone & Belding, the advertising agency. Mrs. Wong-Donohue received bachelor's and M.B.A. degrees from St. John's University. Mr. Donohue graduated from Fairfield University.
